comics.title: Code of Honor (1997) #4
comics.description: Inferno plummets the entire city into madness. Piper makes amends with his wife.

comics.title: Untold Tales of Spider-Man (1995) #20
comics.description: The Vulture’s murderous spree can only be quelled by the Friendly Neighborhood wall-crawler!

comics.title: Untold Tales of Spider-Man (1995) #19
comics.description: Spider-Man takes on Doc Ock! And Aunt May is none the wiser!

comics.title: Spider-Man: Hobgoblin Lives (1997) #3
comics.description: WHO IS THE REAL HOBGOBLIN? Facing death, Spider-Man must find out who the real Hobgoblin is before it’s too late.

comics.title: Untold Tales of Spider-Man (1995) #18
comics.description: The lethal Headsman has an arms supplier who is all too familiar to Spider-Man.

comics.title: Spider-Man: Hobgoblin Lives (1997) #2
comics.description: UNCOVERING THE TRUTH! The Hobgoblin is back and on the loose! Can Spider-Man stop him before another death is added to the tally?

comics.title: Untold Tales of Spider-Man (1995) #17
comics.description: Why is Spider-Man on the wrong side of Hawkeye’s arrow? Black Widow makes an appearance.

comics.title: Code of Honor (1997) #1
comics.description: A new cop discovers what it is to work the super hero beat. Marvel takes to the streets in this gritty, and groundbreaking, series!

comics.title: Spider-Man: Hobgoblin Lives (1997) #1
comics.description: WILL THE REAL HOBGOBLIN PLEASE STAND UP! Jason Macendale’s arrest for Hobgoblin activities brings up many theories and questions on who the REAL Hobgoblin is…

comics.title: Untold Tales of Spider-Man (1995) #15
comics.description: J. Jonah Jameson may be walking into a carefully crafted mob set-up…but not if Spider-Man can help it!

comics.title: Untold Tales of Spider-Man (1995) #14
comics.description: Steven Hudak sets things aflame as the Scorcher!

comics.title: Untold Tales of Spider-Man (1995) #13
comics.description: Who is the Black Knight? Spider-Man suffers a devastating loss when Bluebird loses her wings.

comics.title: Sensational Spider-Man (1996) #8
comics.description: Spider-Man struggles between taking time to recover in the hospital, versus resuming hero duties. Against Aunt May’s insistence, Spidey takes to the costume again, but soon wishes he had stayed in bed! It’s Spider-Man vs. the Looter!

comics.title: Untold Tales of Spider-Man (1995) #12
comics.description: With Bluebird’s assist, Spidey manages to take out Vulture…and the Scarlet Beetle!

comics.title: Untold Tales of Spider-Man (1995) #11
comics.description: Electro and the Eel star in a two-for-one special against Spider-Man!

comics.title: Untold Tales of Spider-Man (1995) #10
comics.description: Will Spidey conquer Commanda, a brazen jewel thief?

comics.title: Untold Tales of Spider-Man (1995) #9
comics.description: Peter Parker brings Batwing to Dr. Connors to help cure him...but ends up in a battle with the fearsome Lizard!

comics.title: Peter Parker, the Spectacular Spider-Man (1976) #229
comics.description: Is this the end of the line for Peter Parker? Ben Reilly becomes the only active Spider-Man!

comics.title: Peter Parker, the Spectacular Spider-Man (1976) #228
comics.description: Peter is overcome with the urge to kill Mary Jane!

comics.title: Peter Parker, the Spectacular Spider-Man (1976) #227
comics.description: Kane meets his fateful end!

comics.title: Peter Parker, the Spectacular Spider-Man (1976) #226
comics.description: The Trial of Peter Parker concludes! Dr. Trainer reaches the wrong conclusion about Spider-Man's true identity...mistaking Ben Reilly as the real Peter Parker!

comics.title: Peter Parker, the Spectacular Spider-Man (1976) #225
comics.description: An all-new Green Goblin rises!

comics.title: Web of Spider-Man (1985) #120
comics.description: The Grim Hunter catches the Scarlet Spider's scent!

comics.title: Web of Spider-Man (1985) #119
comics.description: While healing from his wounds, Ben Reilly's Spider-Sense goes wild. He must don his Scarlet Spider garb and face down Venom yet again!

comics.title: Venom: Separation Anxiety (1994) #1
comics.description: Venom is beaten. Eddie Brock is a captive, with no hope of ever reuniting with his precious symbiote. But little does he know that people are already planning to help him escape – but when Eddie finds out who it is, will he even want to?

comics.title: Web of Spider-Man (1985) #118
comics.description: Ben Reilly and Venom, unbeknownst to one another, take their own strolls down memory lane to see where it all began!

comics.title: Peter Parker, the Spectacular Spider-Man (1976) #217
comics.description: Peter Parker and his clone Ben Reilly join forces in an effort to defeat the Traveler!

comics.title: Web of Spider-Man (1985) #117
comics.description: Peter Parker encounters an identical stranger on the rooftops of Manhattan. In his anger and confusion he gives chase to hunt this doppelganger down!

comics.title: Amazing Spider-Man (1963) #394
comics.description: The mysterious clone of Spider-Man ruminates on the path he has followed the last several years of his life just before a strange visitor presents him with an offer he may not be able to refuse.

comics.title: Marvels (1994)
comics.description: Phineas Thomas Horton is a brilliant inventor on the  brink of great discovery! Like a modern day Prometheus, Horton, unlocking the secrets of creation, hands the world a Human Torch! This is the beginning of Marvels!

comics.title: Spider-Man 2099 (1992) #22
comics.description: Gabe O’ Hara knows his brother is Spider-Man, but can he keep the secret? While Gabe and Miguel recover from their adventure in Cyberspace, Kasey Nash is confronted by Stark- Fujikawa with a corporate deal she can’t refuse. Plus, Miguel’s first love, Xina Kwan is back on the scene! But what is the reason for her return?

comics.title: Spider-Man 2099 (1992) #21
comics.description: Introducing the Maryjanes, a trio of cyber-punk women so tough, they give Spider-Man a run for his money! Will Spider-Man 2099 be able to take down these cold-blooded killers...and save the public from their cyborg weaponry? Plus, Gabe O’ Hara discovers the true identity of Spider-Man!

comics.title: Peter Parker, the Spectacular Spider-Man (1976) #214
comics.description: Typhoid Mary, loose in Manhattan! Surviving an earlier encounter with the villainess, Spider-Man chases down Typhoid and finds her preparing the next slaughter! Spidey intervenes, but can the already-defeated web-slinger handle a second round with Mary, quite contrary?

comics.title: Spider-Man 2099 (1992) #20
comics.description: Spider-Man 2099 vs. Cyberspace! After discovering that his brother is involuntarily hooked into a virtual reality, Miguel must retrieve Gabe from malicious software. Will Spider-Man 2099 be able to stay the course on his most personal mission yet?

comics.title: Peter Parker, the Spectacular Spider-Man (1976) #213
comics.description: While on assignment for the Daily Bugle, Spider-Man comes across a distressed young woman and invites her back to his home. Once invited inside by Mary Jane, the young woman is revealed to be none other than Typhoid Mary! Both Spidey and his love are in serious peril!

comics.title: Spider-Man 2099 (1992) #19
comics.description: After Lyla flies off the handle, and falls off the grid, Miguel discovers that all of Nueva York’s computers have gone off-line. What forces are behind this electrical failure? Gabe O’ Hara falls into trouble when he retreats into a virtual reality. Will Conchata be able to pull her son back to this world? Or will Gabe remain “plugged in” for life?

comics.title: Marvels (1994) #4
comics.description: Even whilst enjoying some success upon getting his first book published, Photographer, Phil Sheldon, continues to be involved with the heroic "Marvels" and the villains of New York City. Don't miss out on this shocking conclusion to Marvels!

comics.title: Spider-Man 2099 (1992) #18
comics.description: Lyla reacts in a jealous rage after Miguel and Dana share an intimate moment. Gabe retreats into virtual reality following his breakup with Kasey. Plus, a special story featuring Miguel O’ Hara from his school days! You’ll never believe what the X-Mansion of 2099 looks like!

comics.title: Spider-Man 2099 (1992) #17
comics.description: Spider-Man 2099 dumped in Downtown! After an unsuccessful confrontation with imposter Thor, Spidey finds himself cursing his involvement in the battle for Valhalla. The Aesir battle for Mjolnir, but who is truly worthy? Plus, Doom 2099 pulls the wool over everyone’s eyes with a shocking coup!

comics.title: Spider-Man 2099 (1992) #16
comics.description: THE FALL OF THE HAMMER PART 1 Has Thor truly returned to 2099? If so, the God of Thunder has lost his sense of honor! Spider-Man must take down an imposter Thor, and protect Dana from becoming a “sport of the gods”!

comics.title: Spider-Man 2099 (1992) #15
comics.description: THE RISE OF THE HAMMER Jordan Boone lets slip a valuable secret on Alchemax, and his lack of discretion costs him dearly. What is the Valhalla Project Boone spoke of? Miguel discovers that Lyla may have significant technical errors, while Conchata O’ Hara investigates Spider-Man on her own terms. Who are these new incarnations of Thor and Heimdall? And are they really immortal beings of Asgard?

comics.title: Spider-Man 2099 (1992) #14
comics.description: Miguel O’ Hara learns the laws of reality don’t exist in Interspace. Gabe O’Hara discovers a shocking development with his girlfriend Kasey. And Net Prophet shows the full range of his reality-warping powers. Will Spider-Man finally escape Interspace?

comics.title: Spider-Man 2099 (1992) #13
comics.description: Tyler Stone and Spider-Man under the will of Thanatos! What devious plans will Thanatos set into motion when he breaks into Alchemax’s Virtual Unreality Lab? And who is the mysterious figure from the Interspace Portal? Spider-Man vs. Thanatos in the Interspace!

comics.title: Spider-Man 2099 (1992) #12
comics.description: Who is Thanatos? How did he achieve his warrior strength? And what beef does he have with Alchemax? Spider-Man 2099 meets a worthy opponent in battle, brawn, and fortitude! Jordan Boone finds himself in trouble yet again.

comics.title: Spider-Man 2099 (1992) #11
comics.description: When a vandal acts against criminal corporation Alchemax, the Public Eye will stop at nothing to teach a lesson! Enter Miguel O’ Hara to save the day. Will Spider-Man 2099 be able to outrun the technical weaponry of S.I.E.G.E.? And will Miguel and Dana get a much needed vacation?

comics.title: Spider-Man 2099 (1992) #11
comics.description: When a vandal acts against criminal corporation Alchemax, the Public Eye will stop at nothing to teach a lesson! Enter Miguel O’ Hara to save the day. Will Spider-Man 2099 be able to outrun the technical weaponry of S.I.E.G.E.? And will Miguel and Dana get a much needed vacation?

comics.title: Web of Spider-Man (1985) #103
comics.description: MAXIMUM CARNAGE PART 10 Cloak, Morbius, and Black Cat face off against Carrion, Demogoblin, and Doppelganger!

comics.title: Amazing Spider-Man (1963) #380
comics.description: MAXIMUM CARNAGE PART 11 Spider-Man and his teammates must contend with Shriek while Venom is tortured by Carnage!

comics.title: Spider-Man (1990) #37
comics.description: MAXIMUM CARNAGE PART 12 After clearing the streets of wild and enraged denizens of New York City, Spider-Man and his team are ready for an epic showdown with Carnage and his cronies!

comics.title: Spider-Man (1990) #36
comics.description: MAXIMUM CARNAGE PART 8 Spider-Man, Venom, Black Cat, Cloak, and Firestar enlist J. Jonah Jameson in their war against Carnage!

comics.title: Amazing Spider-Man (1963) #379
comics.description: MAXIMUM CARNAGE PART 7 Spider-Man, along with Venom, Cloak, and Black Cat head to a place from Cletus Kasady's past to search for clues as to where Carnage might be.

comics.title: Web of Spider-Man (1985) #102
comics.description: MAXIMUM CARNAGE PART 6 Venom, Cloak and Black Cat set out to locate Morbius and have him join up in the fight against Carnage!

comics.title: Web of Spider-Man (1985) #101
comics.description: MAXIMUM CARNAGE PART 2 Spider-Man, Cloak, and Dagger face off against the deranged Doppelganger!

comics.title: Spider-Man (1990) #35
comics.description: MAXIMUM CARNAGE PART 4 As the battle between good and evil heats up, strange alliances are formed. Can a partnership between Venom and Spider-Man remain stable long enough to take Carnage down?

comics.title: Amazing Spider-Man (1963) #378
comics.description: MAXIMUM CARNAGE PART 3 Venom and Spider-Man are on the hunt for Carnage on the streets of New York!

comics.title: Spider-Man (1990) #23
comics.description: The Fantastic Four foray into the fray to fight the foes no single Spider-Friend could withstand!

comics.title: Silver Sable & the Wild Pack (1992) #1
comics.description: The heat is on when Hydra kidnaps Silver Sable’s niece! Silver Sable, Spider-Man and Sandman must take down Hydra’s many heads to save young Anna!

comics.title: Spectacular Spider-Man Annual (1979) #12
comics.description: THE HERO KILLERS PART 2.  There's a mysterious villain looking to put an end to Spidey and the New Warriors and this mystery figure is using new and deadlier Dreadnoughts to take down the heroes.

comics.title: Spider-Man (1990) #22
comics.description: The guest-stars keep on coming as the Webbed Wonder is now also joined by Sleepwalker! Will Spidey and his myriad of allies triumph in the end?

comics.title: Spider-Man (1990) #21
comics.description: The vicious battle with the Sinister Six rages on as Spidey and his allies are put on the defensive.

comics.title: Spider-Man (1990) #20
comics.description: It's guest-stars galore as the Web-Slinging Wonder is joined by Solo, Nova, Deathlok, and the Incredible Hulk to face off against the Sinister Six!

comics.title: Spider-Man: Fear Itself (1992) #1
comics.description: The mad Baroness has her hands on the most destructive force in the Marvel Universe: The Cassidy Crystals! Spider-Man must prevent the deployment of a weapon that induces nightmarish terror. Find out why the only thing we have to fear…is fear itself!

comics.title: Spider-Man (1990) #19
comics.description: The Hulk arrives to aid the Wallcrawler against the threat of the Sinister Six!

comics.title: Amazing Spider-Man Annual (1964) #26
comics.description: THE HERO KILLERS PART 1.  Spider-Man and the New Warriors team-up to investigate Target Technologies complex, but will they be able to withstand an attack from the powerful Dreadnoughts?

comics.title: Spider-Man (1990) #18
comics.description: The Sinister Six attack! It's up to Spidey and Ghost Rider to stop them in their tracks. But they have a new sixth member who may be their most powerful yet!

comics.title: X-Force (1991) #4
comics.description: SABOTAGE PART 2 It's Warpath, Feral, Shatterstar, and Spider-Man versus the Juggernaut!

comics.title: Spider-Man (1990) #15
comics.description: Spider-Man teams up with Beast of the Uncanny X-Men to fight Powerhouse and Masterblaster!

comics.title: X-Force (1991) #3
comics.description: X-Force gets caught up in an explosive situation in Manhattan. Good thing everyone's favorite neighborhood Spider-Man is there to help out!

comics.title: Spider-Man (1990) #14
comics.description: SUB-CITY, Part Two! A black-suited Spidey takes on the menace of Morbius, The Living Vampire!

comics.title: Spectacular Spider-Man Annual (1979) #11
comics.description: The Vibranium Vendetta continues as Spider-Man prevents Wakanda’s most valuable resource from falling into Roxxon’s hands. The Sunturion is determined to eliminate Spider-Man, and acquire a Vibranium for his shadowy employer. Plus, a flashback story featuring young Peter’s adventures in babysitting!

comics.title: Spider-Man (1990) #13
comics.description: SUB-CITY, Part One! Spider-Man is back in black in this special issue! What dastardly plot has Morbius concocted?

comics.title: Spider-Man (1990) #12
comics.description: Now Wolverine and Spider-Man are protecting Wendigo?! The tables have turned in this strange issue. Guest-starring Puck and Sasquatch of Alpha Flight!

comics.title: Spider-Man (1990) #11
comics.description: Spider-Man’s Canadian adventure continues as he and Wolverine face off against the Wendigo!

comics.title: Damage Control (1991) #1
comics.description: Featuring the New Warriors, Spider-Man and Hulk! Damage Control is under PR fire when accused of staging disasters for the sake of business.

comics.title: Spider-Man (1990) #10
comics.description: Wolverine is the best there is at what he does, but Spider-Man is pretty good too!

comics.title: Darkhawk (1991) #3
comics.description: Darkhawk's inaugural team-up rages on as he and Spidey battle the Hobgoblin!

comics.title: Spider-Man (1990) #9
comics.description: The Amazing Spider-Man and the Savage Wolverine combat the carnivorous Wendigo!

comics.title: Darkhawk (1991) #2
comics.description: Fledgling hero Darkhawk fights against the demonic Hobgoblin! Guest-starring the Amazing Spider-Man!

comics.title: Spider-Man (1990) #8
comics.description: Spider-Man confronts the wild Wendigo. Wolverine guest-stars as the mythic monster makes a mess!

comics.title: Fantastic Four (1961) #349
comics.description: A Skrull stands revealed underneath Monster Island! But what has roped the new Fantastic Four and the entire Skrull army into a confrontation within the Mole Man's secret lair?

comics.title: Fantastic Four (1961) #348
comics.description: The new Fantastic Four's investigation has taken them all the way to Monster Island, home of the dreaded Mole Man.  Will they find out the truth about the slain FF...or another set of secrets entirely?

comics.title: Spider-Man (1990) #7
comics.description: The stunning conclusion to MASQUES! Will Ghost Rider and Spider-Man be able to set aside their differences to take down the Hobgoblin?

comics.title: Fantastic Four (1961) #347
comics.description: The Fantastic Four are dead!  Long live the new Fantastic Four â€" Spider-Man, Wolverine, Hulk, and Ghost Rider!? Can they get to the bottom of the FF's demise? And just what do the Skrulls want with this new team?

comics.title: Amazing Spider-Man Annual (1964) #25
comics.description: Peter Parker’s origin story is recounted in this exciting annual issue!  In the first segment, Peter uncovers a plot between Empire State University and corrupt mega-corporation Roxxon. What is the valuable resource Roxxon wishes to possess? In a word…vibranium! Guest-starring the Ghost and Ultron-5!

comics.title: Spider-Man (1990) #6
comics.description: The Hobgoblin is losing his mind, and it's up to Spider-Man and Ghost Rider to stop his demonic rampage! Will the Webbed Wonder and the Spirit of Vengeance defeat this vile villain?

comics.title: Amazing Spider-Man (1963) #339
comics.description: THE RETURN OF THE SINISTER SIX PART 6 Doctor Octopus plans to release a deadly poison into Earth's atmosphere so that he can instate himself and the Sinister Six as the world's new leaders! Can Spidey stop the Sinister Six?

comics.title: Amazing Spider-Man (1963) #337
comics.description: THE RETURN OF THE SINISTER SIX PART 4 The new Sinister Six has been assembled! Now with Vulture in the game, the Six is a force to be reckoned with!

comics.title: Amazing Spider-Man (1963) #336
comics.description: THE RETURN OF THE SINISTER SIX PART 3 The Sinister Six is almost complete. Doctor Octopus has already recruited Electro, Sandman, Hobgoblin, and Mysterio. Who will be the last addition?

comics.title: Spectacular Spider-Man Annual (1979) #10
comics.description: SPIDEY’S TOTALLY TINY ADVENTURE PART 2 Spider-Man finds himself tumbling through the Microverse, without any means of escape!

comics.title: Amazing Spider-Man (1963) #335
comics.description: THE RETURN OF THE SINISTER SIX PART 2 Doc Ock has big plans for the Sinister Six. With Electro and Sandman on board already, Spider-Man is going to have his hands full!

comics.title: Amazing Spider-Man (1963) #334
comics.description: THE RETURN OF THE SINISTER SIX PART 1 Doc Ock is bringing the band back together! The Sinister Six is up and running again and Spidey is in for the fight of his life!

comics.title: Amazing Spider-Man Annual (1964) #24
comics.description: SPIDEY’S TOTALLY TINY ADVENTURE PART 1 This is definitely big trouble for little Spidey. Featuring Ant-Man!

comics.title: Peter Parker, the Spectacular Spider-Man (1976) #160
comics.description: ACTS OF VENGEANCE After Spidey's taken down Shocker, Rhino, and Hydro Man, who can possibly stand up to all-new all-powerful Cosmic hero?! Doctor Doom knows who!

comics.title: Peter Parker, the Spectacular Spider-Man (1976) #159
comics.description: ACTS OF VENGEANCE More powerful! More dangerous! More uncontrollable than ever before! Here comes the Cosmic Spidey! But will all that power make a difference against the magical might of the Brothers Grimm?!

comics.title: Peter Parker, the Spectacular Spider-Man (1976) #158
comics.description: ACTS OF VENGEANCE Now he's the strongest hero in the Marvel Universe! This is it! Spidey goes Cosmic!

comics.title: Doctor Strange, Sorcerer Supreme (1988) #9
comics.description: The Man, The Myth, The Magic! A special editorial on Doctor Stephen Strange, as told by Morgana Blessing.

comics.title: Damage Control (1989) #1
comics.description: Who does the world call on in the wake of super hero disasters? Meet the Clean-Up Op that handles the messes no one else wants to touch! Where there’s property damage…there’s Damage Control! Creator Dwayne McDuffie introduces you to the cast of characters responsible for keeping the Marvel Universe clean. It all starts here!

comics.title: Peter Parker, the Spectacular Spider-Man (1976) #110
comics.description: The Death of Jean DeWolff CONCLUSION! The Sin-Eater's identity is revealed... but that sure doesn't stop him from continuing his plans! Who is next on the assailant's list? Shots are fired...but against who?!

comics.title: Peter Parker, the Spectacular Spider-Man (1976) #109
comics.description: The Death of Jean DeWolff PART 3! Spider-Man learns that the Sin-Eater was the one who killed Jean DeWolff. With the Sin-Eater still out on the loose can Spider-Man put an end to his reign before the next victim is claimed?

comics.title: Peter Parker, the Spectacular Spider-Man (1976) #108
comics.description: The Death of Jean DeWolff PART 2! Unhappy about the outcome of the trial, Spider-Man faces more trouble when the Sin-Eater opens fire in the courthouse and creates hysteria!

comics.title: Cloak and Dagger (1985) #3
comics.description: Guest-starring the Amazing Spider-Man! With the help of the Friendly Neighborhood crime fighter, Cloak and Dagger take down a crew of drug traffickers.

comics.title: Peter Parker, the Spectacular Spider-Man (1976) #107
comics.description: The Death of Jean DeWolff PART 1! Eager for justice, Spider-Man finds himself in court with Matt Murdock, also known as "Daredevil", during the trial for the gang attack on Mr. Popchik.

comics.title: Secret Wars (1984) #12
comics.description: NOTHING TO FEAR The heroes have defeated their enemies--all save one. Now, with the stolen power of The Beyonder himself, Doctor Doom strikes! Who can stop him now?

comics.title: Peter Parker, the Spectacular Spider-Man (1976) #100
comics.description: It all converges here! Spider's symbiote suit is on the loose, and all of New York is threatened. Spider-Man and Black Cat find themselves in heated battle with the Kingpin and his strange lackey, Spot! Peter Parker is plagued with nightmares that may foretell a dark future.

comics.title: Secret Wars (1984) #11
comics.description: ...AND DUST TO DUST The penultimate chapter of SECRET WARS is here! The face of Doom is revealed!

comics.title: Marvel Team-Up (1972) #150
comics.description: Spider-Man joins the X-Men to take down Juggernaut! The power of the Cyttorak grows in the mutants' fiercest foe, as all sides scramble to subdue Cain Marko.  Spider-Man has a change of heart about the X-Men- but why?

comics.title: Peter Parker, the Spectacular Spider-Man (1976) #99
comics.description: Peter Parker meets his new neighbors, and things promise to get interesting. While on their way to Kingpin, Spidey and Black Cat encounter the villainous Spot! Plus, Spider-Man's alien costume escapes from the Baxter Building!

comics.title: Secret Wars (1984) #10
comics.description: DEATH TO THE BEYONDER Though the heroes have successfully driven Galactus away, they find that their seeming victory has only sealed their fate.

comics.title: Secret Wars (1984) #9
comics.description: ASSAULT ON GALACTUS As the heroes make their last ditch effort against Galactus, Doctor Doom seizes the opportunity to grind them all under his heel.

comics.title: Marvel Team-Up (1972) #149
comics.description: Spidey and Cannonball of the New Mutants against the electrical menace of the Incandescent Man!

comics.title: Peter Parker, the Spectacular Spider-Man (1976) #98
comics.description: Kingpin drives a wedge between Spider-Man and Black Cat when the source of her 'bad luck powers' are revealed. Will Spidey ever see the Cat reform? Plus, the secret of the Spot discovered by one of Kingpin's scientists!

comics.title: Marvel Team-Up (1972) #148
comics.description: Spider-Man and Thor together against the Black Abbott and his savage Black Apostles in the culmination of the Black Abbott trilogy! The Black Abbott is out to steal the greatest prize of all, the powers of the mighty Thor! Plus, more developments on Spidey's costume!

comics.title: Peter Parker, the Spectacular Spider-Man (1976) #97
comics.description: Introducing Marvel's most miserly character…The Hermit! Spider-Man encounters a man who just wants to left alone. No, really, The Hermit just wants to be alone.

comics.title: Secret Wars (1984) #8
comics.description: INVASION As the battle-weary heroes recuperate and repair their gear, Spider-Man makes make a discovery that will change his life and his costume!

comics.title: Secret Wars (1984) #7
comics.description: BERSERKER The death of an Avenger! The X-Men's greatest battle! And, introducing the all-new Spider-Woman!

comics.title: Marvel Team-Up (1972) #147
comics.description: The Human Torch against the menace of the Black Abbott and the Black Apostles! What they can do to your body and soul is unspeakable!

comics.title: Marvel Team-Up (1972) #146
comics.description: His name is The Black Abbot, and he can mesmerize people with his voice! Can Spidey and Nomad stop him, or the terrible Taskmaster from organizing street gangs in his behalf?

comics.title: Secret Wars (1984) #6
comics.description: A LITTLE DEATH Galactus prepares to destroy both the heroes and the villians! Now, as both sides of the engagement plan their next move, two MIA soldiers make their return!

comics.title: Peter Parker, the Spectacular Spider-Man Annual (1979) #4
comics.description: Featuring a look back into Aunt May's youth, as she is haunted today by an old love, and a secret from her past! How will her web-slinging nephew save her from the dangers without, and within? Plus: a solo tale of the Black Cat!

comics.title: Secret Wars (1984) #5
comics.description: THE BATTLE OF THE FOUR ARMIES The villains have the upper hand! As they plan their final strike, Galactus' mysterious vigil comes to a surprising end...

comics.title: Secret Wars (1984) #4
comics.description: SITUATION: HOPELESS The heroes' HQ has been destroyed! Thor has been captured by Enchantress and taken straight to the villains! Doctor Doom scores his first kill!

comics.title: Secret Wars (1984) #3
comics.description: TEMPEST WITHOUT, CRISIS WITHIN Doctor Doom creates two new villains Called Volcana and Titania to take the heroes down! Meanwhile, Spider-Man battles the X-Men!

comics.title: Secret Wars (1984) #2
comics.description: PRISONERS OF WAR Doctor Doom brings Ultron back online to battle the champions of Earth! Meanwhile, Magneto takes the lone-wolf route!

comics.title: Secret Wars (1984) #1
comics.description: THE WAR BEGINS Earth's heroes have been whisked away to a mysterious construct in space, but they are not alone. Earth's villains have also appeared. Who is to blame for this meeting of good and evil?

comics.title: Marvel Team-Up (1972) #103
comics.description: Scott Lang's ex-prison buddy Gus Sweezer crashes the scene with news on an exciting heist. Does this mean Ant-Man’s back to a life of crime? The Bugle sends Peter Parker on an investigative mission- one that leads straight to Taskmaster! Ant-Man and Spidey take on many villains in one man, as they steal back nuclear weapons from Taskmaster!

comics.title: Marvel Two-in-One (1974) #61
comics.description: A mysterious celestial being called Her is after Adam Warlock, and thinks that Alicia Masters is the key to finding him. Thing must team up with Starhawk in order to save her!

comics.title: Spider-Woman (1978) #20
comics.description: Spider-Woman finally comes face-to-face with Spider-Man while Peter Parker is working on location in Los Angeles!

comics.title: Marvel Team-Up (1972) #86
comics.description: The Amazing Spider-Man partners up with the Guardians of the Galaxy and takes on the devilish duo of Hammer and Anvil!

comics.title: Peter Parker, the Spectacular Spider-Man (1976) #23
comics.description: Spider-Man and Moon Knight fail to defeat Cyclone, the villain who had ties to the Maggia organization. Spider-Man agrees to help Moon Knight find the head mob boss, but not without reservations. Plus, Spider-Man gets a peek inside the mysterious mansion of Steven Grant!

comics.title: Peter Parker, the Spectacular Spider-Man (1976) #22
comics.description: Moon Knight follows a criminal named Lindy to prevent an assassination by the Maggia. Meanwhile, Spider-Man encounters one of Moon Knight’s multiple identities, Jack Lockley. Will Spider-Man and Moon Knight cooperate long enough to stop the Maggia from perpetrating more violence? As both heroes have opposing moral codes, this “team-up” is sure to bring conflict!

comics.title: Nova (1976) #12
comics.description: Richard Rider’s uncle has been murdered! And the suspect is…Peter Parker?!

comics.title: Marvel Two-in-One Annual (1976) #2
comics.description: Spider-Man and Thing find themselves on board Thanos’s ship and besieged by his legions. Meanwhile, Adam Warlock reunites with Gamora and Pip the Troll within the Soul Gem.

comics.title: Super-Villain Team-Up (1975) #9
comics.description: The Avengers are under the collar of Attuma, and their first mission is the elimination of Namor! Will the underwater monarch go on the lam from Earth’s Mightiest Heroes? Not a chance! Namor challenges Attuma head-on, while Doctor Doom exploits Iron Man’s fatal flaw.

comics.title: Marvel Team-Up (1972) #37
comics.description: It’s a monster mash-up when Man-Wolf joins the fray! The Monster-Maker is intent on creating the most horrific being known to man. Luckily, Spider-Man and Frankenstein’s Monster are on the case! S.H.I.E.L.D. intervenes in a big way. Man-Wolf takes a hit.

comics.title: Marvel Team-Up (1972) #36
comics.description: Spider-Man vs. an immortal foe! Ludwig von Shtupf is the Monster-Maker, a scientist brimming with insane ideas and an even zanier disposition. When Spidey awakens next to Frankenstein’s Monster in a shadowy castle, the two must make a narrow escape…or risk becoming Shtupf’s next science project!

comics.title: Super-Villain Team-Up (1975) #1
comics.description: Will Doctor Doom and Sub-Mariner continue to be partners in crime? Their recent heists have fizzled in failure, and the two baddies have an ugly falling out. But will their alliance be renewed when Sub-Mariner falls into trouble and requires Doom's aid?

comics.title: Uncanny X-Men (1963) #83
comics.description: Reprint of Uncanny X-Men (1963) #35

comics.title: Avengers (1963) #59
comics.description: Yellowjacket and the Wasp, trapped in extradimensional torment! To rescue them, the Avengers must appeal to a cosmic entity's good side...literally!

comics.title: Uncanny X-Men (1963) #35
comics.description: The X-Men face there strangest foe yet: The Spectacular Spider-Man!

comics.title: Uncanny X-Men (1963) #27
comics.description: The return of Mimic! The conniving copycat blackmails his way onto the X-Men. But what plans does the Puppet Master have for them all?

comics.title: Amazing Spider-Man (1963) #33
comics.description: A beaten, bruised and nearly broken Spider-Man overcomes all obstacles in his way, pushing past all known limits to survive and fight another day.

comics.title: Amazing Spider-Man Annual (1964) #2
comics.description: A vile new foe has hatched a plot to steal the Wand of Watoomb from Doctor Strange! Spider-Man fights the Circus of Crime!  All this and more in a super-sized spectacular! (note: this issue does not contain the reprinted stories originally printed)

comics.title: Amazing Spider-Man (1963) #25
comics.description: It's Spider-Man versus a super-robot controlled by none other than J. Jonah Jameson!

comics.title: Amazing Spider-Man (1963) #24
comics.description: Spider-Man has a sit down with a shrink named Dr. Rinehart. Is Peter Parker going insane?

comics.title: Amazing Spider-Man (1963) #23
comics.description: What happens when Spidey runs out of web fluid and the Green Goblin empties his bag of tricks? Find out here!

comics.title: Amazing Spider-Man (1963) #22
comics.description: Spider-Man deals justice to the Crafty Clown and his Masters of Menace!

comics.title: Amazing Spider-Man (1963) #21
comics.description: It's Spider-Man and the Human Torch vesus the Beetle!

comics.title: Amazing Spider-Man (1963) #20
comics.description: Another classic Spidey villain makes his debut. Mac Garagan is the Scorpion and he is here to defeat Spider-Man!

comics.title: Amazing Spider-Man (1963) #19
comics.description: Spidey teams up with the Human Torch and sets the stage for one of the most enduring friendships in the Marvel Universe!

comics.title: Avengers (1963) #11
comics.description: The mighty Avengers meet Spider-Man - but what has become of the armored Avenger Iron Man?

comics.title: Amazing Spider-Man (1963) #18
comics.description: Can Spidey live down the shameful events of his last encounter with the Green Goblin? And what does Johnny Storm of the Fantastic Four have to say to Spider-Man?

comics.title: Amazing Spider-Man (1963) #17
comics.description: Flash Thompson invites everyone to attend the first meeting of the Spider-Man fan-club, except Peter Parker! Plus, the Return of the Green Goblin!

comics.title: Amazing Spider-Man (1963) #16
comics.description: Having undergone a form of powerful hypnotic suggestion, Spider-Man duels with Daredevil, the Man Without Fear!

comics.title: Amazing Spider-Man (1963) #15
comics.description: Spider-Man becomes the most dangerous game in a battle of cat and mouse with Kraven the Hunter!

comics.title: Amazing Spider-Man (1963) #14
comics.description: The first major battle between Spidey and his archnemesis, the Green Goblin!

comics.title: Amazing Spider-Man (1963) #13
comics.description: Rumor has it that Spider-Man has been become a thief, robbing establishments in the middle of the night. Little does the public know that someone else is behind all these robberies...and his name is Mysterio!

comics.title: Amazing Spider-Man (1963) #12
comics.description: In a daring battle against Dr. Octopus, Spider-Man is unmasked in broad daylight!

comics.title: Amazing Spider-Man (1963) #11
comics.description: Things heat up between Betty Brant and Peter Parker. Plus, the return of Doctor Octopus!

comics.title: Daredevil (1964) #1
comics.description: The origin of Daredevil, The Man Without Fear!  Matt Murdock is blinded but gains super power abilities he uses to patrol Hell's Kitchen.

comics.title: Amazing Spider-Man (1963) #10
comics.description: Spider-Man versus The Big Man and The Enforcers!

comics.title: Amazing Spider-Man (1963) #9
comics.description: Witness the birth of a classic Spider-Man villain, a man called Electro!

comics.title: Amazing Spider-Man (1963) #8
comics.description: Peter Parker and Flash Thompson's rivalry comes to a head when the boys engage each other in a boxing match after school. But when a computerized menace interrupts the match, it's time for Spidey to swing into action!

comics.title: Avengers (1963) #3
comics.description: Earth's mightiest heroes must face Marvel's mightiest malcontents: the Hulk and the Sub-Mariner, teaming up for the first time! Featuring the Fantastic Four and the X-Men!

comics.title: Amazing Spider-Man (1963) #7
comics.description: Amazing Spider-Man (1963) #6

comics.title: Amazing Spider-Man (1963) #6
comics.description: Spider-Man investigates reports of a strange lizard/human hybrid. Prepare for a showdown with one of Spider-Man's greatest villains, the Lizard!

comics.title: Amazing Spider-Man (1963) #5
comics.description: Everyone's favorite neighborhood Spider-Man engages the Fantastic Four's most powerful enemy, Doctor Doom!

comics.title: Amazing Spider-Man (1963) #4
comics.description: Spider-Man must contend with the villainous might of Sandman. But worst of all, Spidey has to deal with the dreaded...J. Jonah Jameson!

comics.title: Amazing Spider-Man (1963) #3
comics.description: Witness the birth of one of Spider-Man's greatest enemies, the grotesque Dr. Octopus!

comics.title: Amazing Spider-Man (1963) #2
comics.description: The Vulture's rampage in Manhattan begins. Can Spidey take down the avian menace?

comics.title: Amazing Spider-Man (1963) #1
comics.description: Spider-Man, in one of his earliest adventures following Uncle Ben's death, must save a crew of astronauts aboard a malfunctioning space ship!

comics.title: Spider-Man: Spidey Strikes Back Vol. 1 Digest (Trade Paperback)
